item.title: Flights of fancy
item.description:
Source: here.

The black basaltic rock had assumed the delightful shape of a large throne, fit for a mighty rakSha like atikAya, who was slain by the saumitra. It was a cool refugium in the hot plains baked by the eye of mitra and varuNa, a far cry from its origins as a magmatic upwelling from the innards of the Earth around the time of the final demise of the non-avian dinosaurs. I rested facing the direction of the gods. The eye of mArtANDa bhairava behind me, tilting towards the western boundary of the heavenly vault cast light, on her fair beautiful face – accentuating the her sharp features to verily attain the likeness of the foremost of the yakShiNI or apsarA hosts. She expressed her wish to direct an extraordinary nATaka for which purpose she wanted me to inspire her script.

item.title: The Satmala adventures
item.description:
Source: here.

1) Chandvad (Chandradityapura)
2) Chandvad fort
3) chandreshvarI cave temple
4) reNukA temple
5) indrANI temple
6) indragiri durga (Indrai fort)
7) Koldher fort
8)Rajdher fort

After a long bus journey the shUdra, the feral brahmin, Mis-creant and myself entrenched ourselves in the lodge of the lATas. After enjoying a sumptous ghee-rich meal that in our youth we could eat without much thought we proceeded by means of the second bus to middle of nowhere town/village of Chandvad. It is all that remains of the once glorious township founded by the yAdava king dR^iDaprahAra in 801 CE. He and his successors fortified the hill overlooking it to protect it against attacks. However, the strong fort was overcome by the Moslems twice under Alla-ad-din and Awrangzeb during their Jihads in central India. The Maharattas liberated the region during Shivaji’s historic campaigns in the region in the 1660s. Finally it became the mint of Bajirao’s general Malaharao Holkar. The British invaders under Thomas Hislop and McDowell conquered it in 1818 CE after the fierce war for India against the Maharattas. They ravaged the town and detonated the path to the fort top with bombs preventing an easy entry into the fort without scaling sheer rock.

item.title: The split forces and the pralApa
item.description:
Source: here.

The muni and me were in a sense like branches of the same tree. We wondered what might have happened if only the muni and me could have joined our forces on the battle field. Our coordination on the field was unmatched. We saw eye-to-eye in the conduct of campaigns and the like. The only difference was that we matured at different times. I grabbed the vidyAs when they had to be acquired, but the muni ambulated in a random walk for long before he achieved them. This phase-shifted me and him and the locking of the vR^iShabha-shR^i~Nga vyUha never happened.
…o…o…o…
